job_description:
• Join our 30,000 everyday heroes.
• A global technology and professional services company that delivers consulting, technology and mission services to every major agency across the U.
• Government, defense and intelligence community.
• Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation.
• We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development.
• Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology.
• For more information about GDIT's Privacy Policy, click here: https://www.
• Com/privacy-policy/notices/.

• Understanding of critical customer experience factors and after sales service Excellent customer facing communication and interpersonal skills Detail oriented and able to effectively collaborate within a cross functional team Excellent time management skills, with a focus on effective scheduling, prioritization, delegation, and the ability to coordinate and address competing demands Fluent Mandarin and English language skills written and spoken Ability to travel as required within the APAC region to be successful in this field-based role, expected to be at least 65% of the time Bachelor’s degree in Biomedical Engineering / Technology (or equivalent) Multi-year experience with the service and repair of analytical laboratory instruments Demonstrated ability to operate independently and manage multiple priorities Proficiency in Microsoft Suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint Familiarity with microfluidic systems Experience working with optical systems Working knowledge of Linux operating system Test, troubleshoot, and repair instruments and equipment to the Field Replaceable Unit (FRU) level Analyze complex situations and apply independent judgment when resolving problems Interpret past repairs on analytical laboratory instruments to resolve and diagnosis new highly complex issues Assemble and disassemble instruments and equipment Support Pre-staging of instruments to ensure full functionality prior to Sales Inventory transfer Perform electronic, mechanical, pneumatic, programmable logic controllers, liquid, gas, fluidics, and electrical repairs associated analytical laboratory instruments and equipment Provide field based on the job training for Field Service Engineers on the proper preventive maintenance, calibration, and service techniques for analytical laboratory instruments Responsible for supporting upgrade release activities including calibration and configuration of analytical laboratory instruments Monitor personal inventory levels to ensure adequate levels of parts and supplies are available on hand, if not place orders for supplies following company procedures Senior Service Operations EngineerPleasanton, California,
